what:
SweCRIS - Grant Decisions From Swedish Funding Bodies And
    EU
title:
SweCRIS - Grant Decisions From Swedish Funding Bodies And
    EU
text: goal swecris R package provide access data SweCRIS, national database allows see participating research funding bodies distributed money Swedish recipients. SweCRIS managed Swedish Research Council behalf Government. R package uses open API SweCRIS make data available use R.

title:
SweCRIS - Grant Decisions From Swedish Funding Bodies And
    EU
text: can install development version swecris GitHub :

title:
SweCRIS - Grant Decisions From Swedish Funding Bodies And

text: basic example shows get data projects KTH Royal Institute Technology: Given organisation, get information projects: Swedish list (first records): Nordic list referenced SweCRIS also provided:
code: library(swecris) suppressPackageStartupMessages(library(dplyr))  # either fetch the data from the API #kth_projects <- swecris_funding()  # or use the bundled data kthf <- swecris_kth  # top ten largest fundings containing abstracts with the word "data" library(dplyr)  fundings <-    kthf %>%   mutate(total_funding = as.numeric(FundingsSek)) %>%   arrange(desc(total_funding)) %>%   filter(grepl("data", ProjectAbstractEn)) %>%   slice(10)  # display an example record fundings %>%   glimpse() #> Rows: 1 #> Columns: 27 #> $ ProjectId                                    <chr> "2020-05052_VR" #> $ ProjectTitleSv                               <chr> "Terrorism i svensk polit… #> $ ProjectTitleEn                               <chr> "Terrorism in Swedish pol… #> $ ProjectAbstractSv                            <chr> NA #> $ ProjectAbstractEn                            <chr> "SweTerror makes a signif… #> $ ProjectStartDate                             <dttm> 2021-01-01 #> $ ProjectEndDate                               <dttm> 2024-12-31 #> $ CoordinatingOrganisationId                   <chr> "202100-3054" #> $ CoordinatingOrganisationNameSv               <chr> "KTH, Kungliga tekniska h… #> $ CoordinatingOrganisationNameEn               <chr> "KTH, Royal Institute of … #> $ CoordinatingOrganisationTypeOfOrganisationSv <chr> "Universitet" #> $ CoordinatingOrganisationTypeOfOrganisationEn <chr> "University" #> $ FundingOrganisationId                        <chr> "202100-5208" #> $ FundingOrganisationNameSv                    <chr> "Vetenskapsrådet" #> $ FundingOrganisationNameEn                    <chr> "Swedish Research Council" #> $ FundingOrganisationTypeOfOrganisationSv      <chr> "Stat, regioner, kommune… #> $ FundingOrganisationTypeOfOrganisationEn      <chr> "Governmental" #> $ FundingsSek                                  <dbl> 2.2e+07 #> $ FundingYear                                  <dbl> 2021 #> $ FundingStartDate                             <date> 2021-01-01 #> $ FundingEndDate                               <date> 2024-12-31 #> $ TypeOfAwardId                                <dbl> 1 #> $ TypeOfAwardDescrSv                           <chr> "Projektbidrag" #> $ TypeOfAwardDescrEn                           <chr> "Project grant" #> $ InvolvedPeople                               <chr> "¤¤¤17617¤Magnus Ängsal¤… #> $ Scbs                                         <chr> "¤¤¤ 1: Naturvetenskap, N… #> $ total_funding                                <dbl> 2.2e+07 orgid <-    swecris_organisations() %>%   filter(grepl("^KTH, ", organisationNameSv)) %>%   dplyr::pull(organisationId)  kthp <- swecris_projects(orgid)  # ten upcoming projects projects <-    kthp %>% arrange(desc(lubridate::ymd(fundingStartDate))) %>%    select(-starts_with("projectAbstract")) %>%   select(     projectId,      projectTitleEn,      projectStartDate,      projectEndDate,      fundingOrganisationNameEn,      fundingsSek,      fundingYear   ) %>%   head(10)  knitr::kable(projects) sl <-    swecris_list_swedish() #> Rows: 36614 Columns: 12 #> ── Column specification ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> Delimiter: ";" #> chr  (2): ISSN, Titel #> dbl (10): 2012, 2013, 2014, 2015, 2016, 2017, 2018, 2019, 2020, 2021 #>  #> ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data. #> ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.  glimpse(sl %>% head() %>% collect()) #> Rows: 6 #> Columns: 12 #> $ ISSN   <chr> "8756-9728", "8756-7938", "8756-758X", "8756-6583", "8756-6575"… #> $ Titel  <chr> "Project Management Journal", "Biotechnology progress (Print)",… #> $ `2012` <dbl> 1, NA, 1, 1, 1, 1 #> $ `2013` <dbl> NA, 1, 1, 1, NA, NA #> $ `2014` <dbl> 1, 1, 1, 1, NA, NA #> $ `2015` <dbl> 1, NA, 1, 1, NA, NA #> $ `2016` <dbl> 1, 1, 1, NA, NA, NA #> $ `2017` <dbl> 1, 1, NA, 1, 1, NA #> $ `2018` <dbl> 1, NA, 1, NA, NA, NA #> $ `2019` <dbl> 1, 1, NA, NA, 1, 1 #> $ `2020` <dbl> 1, 1, 1, NA, NA, NA #> $ `2021` <dbl> 1, 1, 1, NA, NA, NA  knitr::kable(sl %>% head() %>% collect()) f <- swecris_list_finnish() n <- swecris_list_norwegian  glimpze <- function(df) {   df %>% head() %>% knitr::kable() }  glimpze(f) glimpze(n)

text: Given ORCiD, function retrieves information related projects, subject classification codes (.k.scbs) involved people (peopleList)

title: Projects data from ORCiD — swecris_projects_from_orcid
code: if (FALSE) { if(interactive()){  o <- "0000-0003-1102-4342" |> swecris_projects_from_orcid()  o$projects  o |> purrr::pluck("peopleList")  o$scbs  } }

swecris 0.1.3
text: Added functions searching, getting data specific project related persons SCB codes Refactored functions used older “betasearch” API use new API routes Updated Finnish list work better used Windows OS Added function getting projects data given ORCiD

title: swecris 0.1.2
text: Removed Danish list (longer updated source) Updated Swedish Norwegian list source Updated embedded data projects KTH

title: swecris 0.1.1
text: Added support Swedish, Norwegian, Finnish Danish lists authoritative publication sources

title: swecris 0.1
text: Added basic support routes API described https://swecris-api.vr.se/index.html
